intro: Maytenus variabilis var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. It is often found in dry to moist forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
